subject: Public Speaking
title: The Backfire Effect
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Backfire Effect usable.

hook.text: Directly challenging beliefs often makes people hold them tighter.

buildup.text: The backfire effect means confrontation backfires as persuasion.

discovery.text: Instead, provide new information that lets them discover changes.

twist.text: Let people feel they chose to change. Don't force it.

climax.text: Understanding backfire prevents wasting persuasive effort.

punchline.text: Don't confront. Let them discover instead.
